title: Creutzfeldt-Jakob Disease (CJD): Clinical Overview and Disease Progression
short_description: Clinical documentation describing Creutzfeldt-Jakob disease, a rare degenerative brain disorder characterized by rapidly progressive neurological symptoms and poor prognosis.
long_description: This clinical document provides a comprehensive overview of Creutzfeldt-Jakob disease (CJD), an extremely rare spongiform encephalopathy that causes rapid neurological deterioration. The document details the characteristic symptom progression from initial manifestations including confusion, depression, behavioral changes, and impaired vision/coordination, to advanced stages featuring severe dementia, neuromuscular abnormalities such as myoclonus and athetosis, and ultimately coma with increased infection susceptibility. The text emphasizes the aggressive nature of the disease, noting that life-threatening complications typically develop within less than a year of symptom onset, making this a critical reference for understanding CJD's clinical presentation and prognosis.
